result.execSummary:
The defendant Cynthia Corren Wright was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Cynthia Corren Wright not in court.  Taylor L. Kraus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  There are no appearances by defense.  Defense motion for compassionate release from probation is denied.

Motion hearing on October 12, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant's petition for a compassion-based early release from probation and Affidavit of Cynthia C. Wright.

Attorney Geoffrey R Misfeldt in court.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  ENTRY MADE WITHOUT COURT FILE.  Defense counsel advised the Court that the defendant is with her bedridden mother at the hospital.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until the next court date.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing hearing in Branch 24.  Parties are advised that effective December 14, 2015, this case will be assigned to the Reserve Judge presiding in Branch 21 in room 622 of the Courthouse.
Invoice forwarded to Accounts Payable in the amount of $437.50 to Dr Collins for services on 6/2,6/6, 68 of 2015 copy in file
from defendant:  sentencing materials.

Defendant Cynthia Corren Wright in court with attorney Geoffrey R Misfeldt.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for final pre-trial however, the parties have reached a resolution. Case called at 3:52pm and negotiations were placed on the record. Case passed.
Case recalled. Court ordered the jury trial date of 10/07/15 vacated.
 
As to Count 1: Defendant changes her plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to her plea, advised of her Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 24.

As to Count 2: Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered case dismissed and read-in to the case for the purposes of sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 24, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Cynthia Corren Wright in court with attorney Geoffrey R Misfeldt.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Parties are working on resolving this matter.  Court grants an additional adjournment for a final another final pretrial in Branch 24.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 1, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Order for Competency examination was completed for defendant's other pending cases, 15CM271 and 14CM4687.  However, the Order for Examination did not include this case.  Order for Examination pertaining to this case forwarded to Br. 24 for signature.

Defendant Cynthia Corren Wright in court with attorney Craig S. Powell.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Parties do not challenge the report.  Defense requested a final pretrial and jury trial date in Branch 24.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 8, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for October 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Cynthia Corren Wright in court with attorney Geoffrey R Misfeldt.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  FILE NOT IN COURT.  Doctor's Report Return hearing proceeded.  Defendant contests the findings of Dr. Pankiewicz.  Court appoints Dr. Collins from the Forensic Unit to conduct another examination.  Telephone call to Forensic Unit to schedule the appointment.  Defendant to report for examination on June 2, 2015 at 10:30 a.m.  Matter scheduled for Return on Doctor's Report.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for June 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Review hearing scheduled for June 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.

DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 3:00 P.M. ON  (5/9/15). IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.  Status conference scheduled for 05-12-2015 at 01:30 pm.
